resources.string: I have no time for those who have not dedicated themselves to battle.
Be on your way, citizen.
Commander Ozian Atreus here.
Commander Ozian Atreus here. [ Level 39 required for Great Cleave faction missions ]
Do you blindly accept everything you hear as fact?
Yes, I'm Sai Kumal, the Alchemist, who wants to know?
Yes, I'm Sai Kumal, the Alchemist, who wants to know? [ Level 39 required for Great Cleave faction missions ]
Are you ready to seek riches and glory?
I hope no Corrupted saw you come here, friend. We need to lay low to stay alive.
But you can be safe in my inn. And we have food, thanks to Amis!
Don't let the atmosphere around the outpost get you down!
Anytime now we're going to break through the Corrupted and the tide of battle will turn!
Welcome to Great Cleave, {playerName}! I'm Eppie Grace, the proprietor of the Hound and Hammer Inn.
Stop by any time you like to get out of the chill.
Welcome! I'm Ingram. I wish we were meeting in better circumstances.
I'd give you a mince pie and a mug of ale, but the Corrupted took the last of our supplies.
You've done us a tremendous favor by letting me know the dispatches weren't getting through.
Now we just have to find out how our messengers were compromised. Shh.
<g id="female_salute2finger" />You've done a lot of good for Eastburn Outpost {playerName}.
Now, don't forget to bundle up before heading out into the cold!
<g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />Welcome {playerName}! I'm Ingram Kent.
Don't worry, you can sleep late, no need to be up with the dawn here, even if I am!
Travel to {POITags} to recover Patricia's Heartgem
Travel to {POITags} to recover Patricia's Cloak
Defeat {targetName}
Recover {itemName}
Recover {itemName}
Shadows Cast By A Final Salute
Defeat Captain Patricia to recover her Heartgem. Then retrieve her cloak of office from Slumbering Echoes. Talk to Watcher Sexton in the Eastburn Outpost when the task is complete.
"Who were you expecting?"
I was hoping to see Captain Patricia, but I knew it would be too good to be true.
She was in charge of the rearguard at Cleaves Malice before the fort was overtaken.
"What happened?"
She betrayed us! By the time we realized what was happening, our friends and families had been Corrupted.
We need you to recover her Heartgem, and reclaim her cloak of office from her estate in Slumbering Echoes.
Patricia has become twisted with Corruption.
Patricia's Heartgem…See Corruption swirling inside it?
It finally feels real. She's really gone. She was once a fine Soulwarden, and someone very dear to me.
"Sorry for your loss."
Thank you, but she knew the risks. We all do.
We Soulwardens sometimes forget that we are only protected against Corruption, we aren't immune to it. Patricia was overcome, and we all paid the price.
Travel to {POITags} to defeat Corrupted
Defeat {targetName}
Defeat {targetName}
Malice Aforethought
Break the defenses of the Corrupted by attacking Cleaves Malice. Talk to Warden Phan in the Eastburn Outpost when the task is complete.
"I'm glad to hear it."
I hope that one day this wretched war with the Corrupted will end!
It's really taking a toll on us. The sooner we break their defenses, the sooner we can all get back to what really matters in life.
"What do you think matters?"
Food, friends, family, life! Take your pick, they're all under threat! The Corrupted have cut off one of our major supply routes.
We need you to punch a hole in the guards' defenses at Cleaves Malice. Can you do that?
"Sure, anything else?"
The eager type, are you? I like that! Have you talked to Warden Sexton? He's also looking for someone to travel to Cleaves Malice.
Two birds, one stone, maybe?
Help us break through the defensive line at Cleaves Malice.
You caused a real commotion at Cleaves Malice, {playerName}! A few of our Rangers were able to slip through and deliver the supplies we needed.
It’s not a permanent fix, but it means we can keep fighting tomorrow!
"Wish I could do more."
Wars take time to win. It may not seem like much to you, but for us, it's the difference between a hot dinner and a cold stomachache. That’s worth a lot to my people here.
Thanks again, friend.
Travel to {POITags} to slow down the Icefield workers
Defeat {targetName} Workers
Defeat {targetName}
Descent to Frosted Slumber
Slow the Corrupted by defeating Foreman Robertson and his Icefield workers. Talk to Watcher Chang in the Eastburn Outpost when the task is complete.
"What do you mean?"
We were expanding the village of Slumbering Echoes…that's where I'm from.
When the Corrupted overran it, it was almost too easy for the Corrupted to come and take the lumber.
"Too bad about your village."
We need to stop the construction before it becomes impossible to break their defenses.
Foreman Robertson is the key there. Take him and his work crew out, and we'll finally have the edge we need.
We need you to defeat the Foreman and his work crew. Our best strategy is to keep them from expanding their construction.
Nicely done! War is just as much about swinging hammers as swinging blades.
Now that you’ve taken out the Foreman, their defenses are vulnerable. We can exploit that.
"I hope your village can recover."
Thanks, me too. Still hoping to retire there someday with my family…what's left of it. Just gotta chase all the Corrupted out first.
Travel to {POITags} to recover the Stolen Supplies
Recover Supplies from chests
All That's Left Not Torn Asunder
Recover the Stolen Supplies from Sunderfort and deliver them to Soulwarden Phan in the Eastburn Outpost.
"Yes?"

string.comment: male referring to female (Captain Patricia), male referring to male (Warden Phan)
string.speaker: Watcher Sexton
string.name: WardenSexton

resources.string: Right before Patricia’s betrayal, a shipment of our supplies was stolen by Corrupted and taken to Sunderfort.

string.comment: male referring to female (Captain Patricia), male referring to male (Warden Phan)
string.speaker: Watcher Sexton
string.name: WardenSexton

resources.string: You’ve been such a good distraction, they might not have had time to unload it yet.
"No one's gone after them yet?"
We had other things on our minds at the time. Everything happened so fast…
Would you be willing to go to Sunderfort and recover the supplies if they’re still there?
Think of it! Dried fruit, or perhaps even dried fish... New weapons, more armor, fresh shot...!
You were able to recover some of the supplies? That's a load off my mind.
The world might be ending, but at least we won't go hungry.
"Will you be okay?"
Someday, I think. Right now…I just have to take things one fight at a time. That’s how she would have wanted it.
Thanks for everything.
Travel to {POITags} to discover clues about Corrupted activity
Recover {itemName}
Search for Journal Entry
Facets of Light and Darkness
Recover Heartgems from the Valleyrend Corrupted in Sunderfort, and find clues about Corrupted activity in the area. Talk to Ranger Knatchbull in the Eastburn Outpost when the task is complete.
"What do you need?"
We paid a steep price in the battle for Sunderfort. Many of our friends fell, and Corruption still has them.
I see them when I scout the fort: puppets with the faces of my comrades.
"That's rough."

So many Soulwarden puppets in one place means that they’re planning something. I’d like you to search the fort for clues. While you’re there, please lay my friends to rest and recover their Heartgems.
Aside from recovering those Heartgems, we need to find out what the Corrupted are doing at Sunderfort.
Yes, I recognize these Heartgems. I’ll give them to the Wardens for purification.
As for me, it’s enough to know that they’re no longer tools of the enemy. That’s the best I can do for them now.
"I also found this note."
This page you've found... this is written in whatever tongue the Corrupted share. I can’t read it, but I may know someone who can.
Maybe we can learn something from all this. Thank you, Soulwarden.
Travel to {POITags} to uncover the secret of Corrupted ore
Defeat {targetName} Workers
Recover {itemName}
Recover {itemName}
Transmuting Iron to Dust

Slow the Corrupted war effort by defeating the Molderpick workers at the Defiler Excavation, and uncover the secret of the Corrupted ore. Talk to Watcher Chang in the Eastburn Outpost when the task is complete.
"What is it now?"
The Molderpick Corrupted have captured the old iron mine to the west. We’re calling it ‘Defiler Excavation’ now.
But the weird part is, we got our hands on some of the ore they’re mining there, and it’s...
"It's what?"
It’s terrible. You can crush it in your fist, like dirt. The iron we used to mine there was perfectly usable; something weird is going on.
Go to the Defiler Excavation and see what you can find out about this ore.
If that ore is iron, it's the worst iron I've ever seen.
You're back! Strange, this ore seems perfectly fine. Strong, even.
And you say you found these vials throughout the mines? I wonder what happens when I pour it on the ore…
"Let's find out."
Yes, just as we thought. Now it’s as weak as the rest.
Why would the Corrupted do this? Why would they need this shoddy iron dust? There must be something else we're missing.
Travel to {POITags} to extract Azoth from Ancient statues
Travel to {POITags} to extract Azoth from Ancient statues
Travel to {POITags} to extract Azoth from Ancient statues
Defeat {targetName} Guardian
Extract Azoth from the fallen Ancient statues
Redefining Boundaries
Collect Azoth Infused items from Catara Falls, Gelida Pillars, and Concretus Steps
"What do we need?"
Is this your first cleansing ritual? I envy you. Cleansing a Heartgem consumes Azoth… a lot of it. But with all the Corruption here, there’s not enough ambient azoth to pull it off.
We’ll need to get creative.
"I can do creative."
That’s what I like to hear. We can use Azoth-infused items for the ritual.
We’re running low on them - and everything else - but you may find what's needed in the remains of the fallen Ancient statues.
Catara Falls, Gelida Pillars, and Concretus Steps all have what we need to purify the Heartgems.
Oh, my, impressive! You've manage to gather all the materials we need to purify the Heartgems.
Those Guardians didn't give you too much trouble, did they?
"Nothing I couldn't handle."
That’s what I figured. You’re strong, {playerName}, in more ways than one.
I hope that if I ever fall to Corruption, there will be someone like you around to do this ritual for me.
Travel to Tempest Lane
Travel to Braided Borough
Search for traces of Warden Sexton
Search for more traces of Warden Sexton
The Ties That Blind
Locate the missing Soulwarden Sexton, and report his whereabouts to Warden Dimka in the Cleave's Point Outpost.
"Sure, what do you need?"

string.comment: male referring to male (him = Liam), male referring to female (Warden Dimka)
string.speaker: Warden Phan
string.name: WardenPhan

resources.string: Can I just say again how much I love your can-do attitude?

string.comment: male referring to male (him = Liam), male referring to female (Warden Dimka)
string.speaker: Warden Phan
string.name: WardenPhan

resources.string: Anyway, Warden Sexton went to deliver a message to Cleave’s Point, and he hasn’t come back. It’s not like him. Could you go find him?
"Are you worried about him?"
Oh, not me. It’s Dimka. She’s devoted to him, and she’s been so worried. Won’t eat, won’t sleep… I’m more worried about her than him, to be honest.
Please, find Sexton and help me put Dimka’s mind at rest.
With the losses we've suffered, every person is vital.
You have letters for me? Odd, I've never met you before and I think I would have remembered you.
"Not from me… I'm sorry."
Oh, James, no… how could this have… wait. These love letters are not addressed to me. They’re all addressed to Patricia.
So he really did love her… Spark, I feel like such a fool right now.
Recover {itemName}
Travel to {POITags} to recover the Secret Caches
Breakaway Fort
Travel to {POITags} to recover the Secret Caches
Acedia Bastion
For A Rainy Day
Recover the Secret Caches at Breakaway Fort and Acedia Bastion. Talk to Soulwarden Dimka in the Cleave's Point Outpost when the task is complete.
"I'm really sorry about Sexton."
Please, don’t. You mean well, but the last thing I need right now is pity.
James…Warden Sexton…his letters weren’t all love letters. There’s a report in here that says that the Corrupted are stockpiling ammunition.
"Can I help?"
Yes, you absolutely can. That ammunition would be far better off in our hands. The report says they’re smuggling it in fake barrels and burying them at Breakaway Fort and Acedia Bastion.
If you find the ammunition, bring it here.
Breakaway Fort and Acedia Bastion have secret ammo caches located in false containers, and have likely buried some already.
What’s that? Oh, the ammunition. Sorry, I was miles away.
Yes, this is it. This ammunition should carry us through the next few raids. Thank you, Soulwarden.
"Are you going to be okay?"
I… don't know. I need to think. Thanks for everything, but… this is something no one can help me with.

Explore Breakaway Fort
Explore Hollowing Fort
Explore Nullcavity

Travel to {POITags}
Travel to {POITags}

string.comment: itemName = "Breakaway Fort Heartgem" / "Acedia Bastion Heartgem" / "Hollowing Fort Heartgem" / "Nullcavity Heartgem" , POI = "Breakaway Fort" / "Acedia Bastion" / "Hollowing Fort" / "Nullcavity"

resources.string: Recover {itemName} from {targetName} Corrupted
Search for 'Twisted Smelter' entry
Search for 'Bonemeal' entry
Search for 'Ritual Mine' entry
Search for 'Clearcutting' entry
Rainbow Hearts, Shadowed Intent

Recover Soulwarden Heartgems from the Corrupted. Search for clues about the Corrupted plans in Breakaway Fort, Acedia Bastion, Hollowing Fort, and Nullcavity. Talk to Ranger Law in the Cleave's Point Outpost when the task is complete.
"Seems like a lot."
It’s… not ideal, no. It’s also not great that those forts are full of Corrupted Soulwardens.
Our comrades and friends, who fought and fell beside us… They and the forts both belong to Corruption now.
"That's terrible."
Ah, but now, things are different. Now, we’ve got you.
Could you please try and recover Heartgems from my Corrupted friends at the forts? And while you’re there, keep an eye out for clues, weaknesses, secrets.
Please, return with any Heartgems you can in Acedia Bastion, Breakaway Fort, Hollowing Fort, and Nullcavity.
You brought back the Heartgems! Oh, wonderful. Now my friends won't be tortured anymore.
You also found… symbols? I’ve seen these before… the Corrupted carve them on the floating obelisks.
"What will you do with them?"
The Heartgems, we will purify. It’s really quite a beautiful ceremony.
As for these papers, I’ll send them along to my friend. She’s working to crack the code, you see. Someday, she’ll succeed. Thank you so much.
Travel to the {POITags} to recover Azoth-Infused Lanterns

string.comment: itemName = "Azoth Infused Lantern" , targetName = "Miststride" , POI = "Wayward Mounds" (Region)
string.speaker: UI – Tracker Text

resources.string: Retrieve {itemName} from Miststride Ghouls
A Burning Question
Recover Azoth-Infused Lanterns from Miststride Ghouls in the Eeriedune Graveyard and Misty Borough. Talk to Watcher Owens in the Cleave's Point Outpost when the task is complete.
"Why do you ask?"
Have you heard of the ghost lights, the ignes fatui, the lanterns that flicker in the Eeriedune Graveyard? Never filled, never fueled, always burning?
I need to learn more about their properties!
"What's special about them?"
The Corrupted don't go near them. If we can find out why, maybe we can harness their protection as well!
You can find the lanterns at the Eeriedune Graveyard and in Misty Borough. Please, hurry back!
Return the lanterns to me, so I can uncover their secrets.
The lanterns... There's no light, no glow, not even a flicker! Yet they don't appear to be broken...
Whatever causes them to glow must come from the Ghouls themselves...
"Can you use them?"

string.comment: chaíre = hee-YE-re, Greek for "see you soon"
string.speaker: Watcher Owens
string.name: WardenOwens

resources.string: I plan on taking the lanterns apart to see how they work, of course. Perhaps if we find a way to light them, they'll still hold the Corrupted at bay.

string.comment: chaíre = hee-YE-re, Greek for "see you soon"
string.speaker: Watcher Owens
string.name: WardenOwens

resources.string: Thank you for these, chaíre.

string.comment: itemName = "Blackened Talisman" , targetName = "Miststride Flailer" , POI = "Eeriedune Graveyard"
string.speaker: UI – Tracker Text

resources.string: Recover {itemName} from {targetName}
Recover {itemName} from {targetName}
Kill {targetName}
Travel to {POITags} to determine if Herald Abraxas will aid the Soulwardens
Travel to {POITags} to stop Herald Abraxas
Search for '​Pictures On The Wall' entry
Search for 'Scorched Earth' entry
Blessings of the Fallen
Discover how Herald Abraxas blessed Misty Borough, and determine if the Heralds will aid the Soulwardens. Talk to Watcher Magoro in the Cleave's Point Outpost when the task is complete.
"Sounds wonderful."

string.comment: male referring to male (holy Herald = Herald Abraxas)
string.speaker: Watcher Magoro
string.name: WardenMagoro

resources.string: It does, doesn’t it? I’ve been hearing stories about the Misty Borough and Herald Abraxas since I was a child. He’s something of a hero to me.

string.comment: male referring to male (holy Herald = Herald Abraxas)
string.speaker: Watcher Magoro
string.name: WardenMagoro

resources.string: If only we had someone like him on our side in this fight… the war would be over tomorrow!
"Herald Abraxas?"
That's him! The legends say that he and his followers arrived in Misty Borough, seeking paradise.
I wouldn't be surprised if they were still there. How wonderful that would be! Maybe they could even fight with us!
If it's true, and the Herald's sacred power truly does protect his village from Corruption, perhaps we could use it across the island!
Ah! You're back! Will Herald Abraxas help us in the fight against the Corrupted? Did you discover how the hilltop is protected?
"You're not going to like it."
Oh… I see. They’re protected from Corruption because they became Lost. In any case, thank you. I’ll destroy these talismans.
I guess some legends are better off staying legends.
Travel to {POITags} to recover stolen Heartgems
Defeat {targetName}
Reclaim {itemName}s from the Corrupted Pillars
Twisted Metamorphosis
Defeat Gravespoil Vicars in Capitulum Prime, and return the stolen Heartgems to Watcher Owens in the Cleave's Point Outpost.
"Strange AND horrifying?"
Yes, both! Rangers have reported the theft of a cache of Corrupted Heartgems. The same Heartgems you recovered from our former comrades at the fallen forts!
I knew we shouldn’t have kept them all in one place…
"Who stole them?"
The Gravespoil Vicars who haunt Capitulum Prime… los odio, I hate them. We think they’re using them in some kind of ghoulish ritual.
I’m sorry to ask you recover the same Heartgems twice, but… please get them back!
We can't let the Gravespoil Vicars use those Heartgems in their rituals.

string.comment: female referring to female (Warden = Warden Dimka)
string.speaker: Watcher Owens
string.name: WardenOwens

resources.string: You’re back! Did you recover the Heartgems? Or were we too late?
"I've got them safe and sound."
Oh, thank the Spark. Yes, they’re all here… my old friends. I’d recognize them anywhere.
Thank you so much, {playerName}. I will be having serious words with whoever was storing all these Heartgems in one place.
Travel to {POITags} to defeat former Soulwarden Sauquillo Dimka
Recover {itemName}
The Best of Us
Defeat former Soulwarden Sauquillo Dimka, and return her Heartgem to Watcher Magoro in the Cleave's Point Outpost.
"What happened to her?"
Ever since you brought the news of Sexton’s death… and, um, romantic betrayal… Dimka couldn’t take it. She was so sad, and angry, and embarrassed. In her despair, Corruption took her.
"Oh no, where is she?"
When she realized what was happening, she fled north. She didn’t want to hurt us.
We think she got as far as Sever Castra, before she fell. Oh, Dimka… I wish I could have helped her.
I’m sorry to ask for your help once again, but… you seem so strong. And you didn’t know Dimka like we did. Maybe that will make this easier.

string.comment: male referring to female (her = Archaeologian Sauquillo)
string.speaker: Watcher Magoro
string.name: WardenMagoro

resources.string: That's Dimka’s Heartgem. It's hard to believe that she's gone…

string.comment: male referring to female (her = Archaeologian Sauquillo)
string.speaker: Watcher Magoro
string.name: WardenMagoro

resources.string: She was brilliant, kind, vibrant... and now, she's some twisted and Corrupted thing. Is this the fate that awaits us all?
"No. We will win this war."
Yes… you’re right. This is why it’s so important for us to keep our spirits as high as we can, because if we don’t…
Thank you. I’ll lay Dimka’s purified Heartgem to rest next to Sexton’s… and Patricia’s.
Travel to {POITags}
The Winding Mountain Path
Deliver Orders to Soulwarden Ducquet of Valor Hold Outpost in Edengrove. Talk to Warden Yseult in Shattered Mountain when the task is complete.
"Glad I could help."
If you're willing to continue helping the Soulwardens, there's another place that could really use it.
In Edengrove is the Valor Hold Outpost. They’re in the belly of the beast over there.
"What do they need?"
So much. Food, arms, reinforcements. Above all, they could use some good news. That’s you.
Take this letter to Warden Ducquet in Valor Hold. Stick to the roads, though they're not much safer. Auf wiedersehen, my friend.
Remember, stick to the path.
Your compass is backwards if you're heading for safety. You want safety, head for the coasts!
Ah, I see, orders from Soulwarden Owens? Let's have a look then…
"What's it say?"
Says you've bested a good measure of those Corrupted in Great Cleave, and you're here to help.
We could use the help, sure enough. Let's find something for you to do!
As Good As My Word
Find Ranger Heo Do-yun's previous associates. Once found, let them know Heo Do-yun is still alive.
Find and talk to Ranger Jasvir Tenavan
Find and talk to Ranger Marikit Rizal
<g id="male_nodProud" />You may have heard of me, lucky Heo. No? <g id="female_disappointed" />That's a first.
<g id="male_explain" />Here I thought everyone knew how I survived the destruction of three separate bastions… <g id="male_hanghead" priority="high" />not that it did me any good.

string.comment: First Quest: As Good as My Word
string.speaker: Ranger Heo Do-yun
string.name: HeoDoyun

resources.string: <g id="male_guiltyLookdown" />The story of how I came to be here is a long one, filled with much hardship.

string.comment: First Quest: As Good as My Word
string.speaker: Ranger Heo Do-yun
string.name: HeoDoyun

resources.string: <g id="male_nodProud" />I have survived the destruction of three bastions, <g id="male_hanghead" />though many of the other rangers assigned there were not so lucky.
"How did you escape?"
<g id="female_shrugNothingicando" />I had the "good fortune" to be off scouting when the Corrupted struck.
<g id="male_explain" />I was cut off from the others, but I was able to track them here. <g id="male_headShakeNo" />If we don't find them soon, I fear they may fall to Corruption.
"The Corrupted have taken others."
<g id="male_headShakeNo" />Then the situation is more dire than I thought. <g id="female_saluteFistchest" />We rangers are a hardy lot, but some things no one should endure.
<g id="male_convince01" />If you find them before I do, let them know I survived.
<g id="female_beckonLarger" />Please look for any surviving rangers. <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />It would be heartening to know I wasn't the only survivor, this time.
Have you seen the Corrupted ahead? They are up to something, and I intend to discover what it is!
I have never seen the Corrupted so active like they are here. I believe the enemy is going to make their final move soon.
"Did you know Heo Do-yun is alive?"
That man has more lives than a cat! If he survived there may yet be hope for the rest of us!
"He was really worried about you."
He's always worried about the rest of us! But I'm fine.
I was able to get free on my own, but there are others nearby the Corrupted have taken. I couldn't just leave them.
The bastion Do-yun and I were stationed at may be overrun, but our work is not done.
I shall stay here and watch the Corrupted so that next time we'll have warnings before they attack.
I'd give anything to be back at home…
Ah! You've found me! Here I thought everyone had given up on us after our bastion was overrun.
Have you found any others?
"Were you stationed with Heo?"
I was, along with Jasvir. I feared the worst, but if you have news, that means all is not lost.
"Heo Do-yun is alive."
Ha! He was always the best of us, always believing that Corruption could be overcome if we worked together.
I'll finish here and head for safer ground. Thank you, friend!
Do-yun is brave to keep watch against the growing darkness. If he isn't giving up, neither am I.
I'll patrol near here and send reports back about the movements of the Corrupted.
<g id="female_beckonLarger" />You have the look of someone who has good news!<g id="female_leanforwardListen" /> I take it others survived the attack?
"Yes, Jasvir and Marikit survived."
<g id="female_cheerFistpump" />Things are looking up! <g id="female_smackfist" />Three are more than enough to start a new bastion, or at least a watchtower.
<g id="male_nodProud" />We'll build it at a strategic location to continue to spy on the Corrupted.
Map the landscape to the west
Map the landscape to the east
Mapping The Edge Of Despair
Find the best locations to map out enemy camps in northern Great Cleave. Then bring your notes back to Ranger Heo Do-yun.

string.comment: Second Quest: Mapping the Edge of Despair
string.speaker: Ranger Heo Do-yun
string.name: HeoDoyun

resources.string: <g id="male_explain" />It's obvious the Corrupted have plans for this area. Have you noticed how the breaches get worse when they are around? <g id="female_crossarms" priority="high" />There is a clear connection.

string.comment: Second Quest: Mapping the Edge of Despair
string.speaker: Ranger Heo Do-yun
string.name: HeoDoyun

resources.string: <g id="female_leanforwardListen" />We have to find a way to predict where they will strike next.
"Is that why you are still here?"
<g id="male_headNodYes" />Yes. I was sent to map the supply lines of the Corrupted. <g id="male_gestureAhead" />With you here, we could cover more ground.
<g id="male_explain" />I scouted out several promising locations, but I didn't have time to make maps, <g id="male_guiltyLookdown" />not before the bastion was destroyed.
"What am I looking for?"
<g id="female_gestureAroundRoom" priority="high" />I've set up telescopes and map paper at sites that overlook key Corrupted locations.
<g id="male_gestureAhead" />If you could travel to each one and make a fresh map to bring back to me, <g id="female_saluteFistchest" />I would appreciate the extra help.
<g id="male_explain" />We need accurate maps if we are to track what the Corrupted are up to. <g id="male_fistpumpRight" />Each piece of new information brings us closer to victory!

<g id="female_salute2finger" />You, my friend, are an extremely competent mapmaker. <g id="male_spreadhands" />I know it couldn't have been easy to write in the cold, <g id="male_nodProud" />but this linework is excellent!
<g id="female_leanforwardListen" />Now let me compare these to our older maps.
"Has there been any change?"
Hmm… <g id="male_headShakeNo" />not as much as I expected. <g id="female_crossarms" />And that troubles me.

<g id="female_thinking" />It could mean their attention is elsewhere, somewhere we can't see. <g id="female_crossarms" />We'll have to look into this when we can, <g id="male_nodProud" />but something else needs my attention first.
Search {POITags} for Mardea's Shield and Hanu's Spear
Recover Mardea's Shield
Recover Hanu's Spear
Search {POITags} for Topalian's Helm and Kaipo's Axe
Recover Topalian's Helm
Recover Kaipo's Axe
Picking Up The Pieces
Recover weapons and armor from Ranger Heo Do-yun's fallen companions. Recover Mardea's Shield, Hanu's Spear, Topalian's Helm, and Kaipo's Axe.

string.comment: Third Quest: Picking Up the Pieces
string.speaker: Ranger Heo Do-yun
string.name: HeoDoyun

resources.string: <g id="female_thinking" />Since the Corrupted have given us a bit of breathing room, <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />I'm going to take this time to honor our fallen.

string.comment: Third Quest: Picking Up the Pieces
string.speaker: Ranger Heo Do-yun
string.name: HeoDoyun

resources.string: <g id="male_guiltyLookdown" />There are so many fine rangers that didn't make it out of the bastions alive.
"How do you plan on honoring them?"
<g id="male_explain" />When we build a new bastion, I plan on putting their prized weapons and armor on display <g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" />so that we never forget their sacrifices.
<g id="male_spreadarms001" />Each of them left something behind. <g id="male_headShakeNo" />Until now, I haven't had the time to recover them.
"What do you need me to find?"

<g id="male_explain" />Mardea never had time to recover her shield. <g id="male_headShakeNo" />Hanu went down with her spear. <g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" priority="high" />Topalian's helm was knocked off during the attack.
<g id="male_explain" />And Kaipo's axe whirled through many before he fell. With those, I can honor my lost friends.

<g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />Their warrior spirits will live on forever, <g id="male_explain" />but those of us who didn't fall would be reminded about their strength and courage if we had something to remember them by.
<g id="male_explain" />Mardea's Shield, as good at absorbing blows as she was hardship. <g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" priority="high" />Hanu's quick wit, as sharp as the spear she fought with.
<g id="male_spreadarms001" />Topalian's Helm, as bright as their personality. And Kaipo's Axe, as large as his generosity.
"They sound like good friends."
<g id="male_headNodYes" />They were. And with these items, <g id="male_spreadhands" />it's as if they're standing right beside me.
<g id="female_leanforwardListen" />I can hear their voices now, laughing about my luck. <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />I'll toast their bravery later.
<g id="male_spreadhands" />Just you wait, our next bastion will be our best yet! <g id="female_salute2finger" />The Corrupted won't overrun it so easily, thanks to your help!
The Balemaw Beast
Find the notorious Balemaw Beast which has been preying on travelers in the region.
Follow clues to the Balemaw Beast
Confront the false Balemaw Beast
<g id="female_lookConcern" />There are troubling rumors that haunt these roads.
<g id="female_lookaroundScared" />Tales of the Balemaw Beast, of winter wolves, and even Yetis mauling innocent travelers. <g id="female_smackfist" />Be wary!
<g id="female_salute2finger" />Greetings, may you stay safe on the roads.
<g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" priority="high" />There have been troubling tales lately of a beast that roams the nearby woods which preys upon unsuspecting travelers.
"What manner of beast?"

<g id="female_smackfist" />The Balemaw Beast is taller than a person and covered in fur! <g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" priority="high" />It has glowing eyes that pierce through the snow and claws as long as daggers.
<g id="male_explain" />It jumps out from behind the trees and vanishes into the woods just as quickly.
"Has it harmed anyone?"
<g id="male_headShakeNo" />That's where the tale gets muddy. <g id="male_quidproquo" />Some say it attacked them, others say it runs off without a fight.
<g id="male_explain" />Either way, it's a menace and I'd appreciate it if you tracked down the truth behind the rumors.
<g id="female_leanforwardListen" />Have you discovered any clues to the whereabouts of the Balemaw Beast?
Rawr! Grah! Oh! You’re not from around here. Look, just, don't tell anyone I'm here, alright?
Grah! Hey, you aren't running away! And... is that a weapon? Whatever I did, I can explain!
"You're the rampaging beast?"
I swear, all I do is jump out at people! I haven't hurt anyone.
This all started as just a harmless bit of fun, so that people could see the myth without any danger.
I swear, my scaring days are over.
I'll head back to the settlement soon, I promise.
From your expression you have discovered something… <g id="female_leanforwardListen" />Please let it not be another body. Tell me truthfully, I can handle the worst.
"The beast was a man named Bob."
<g id="male_quidproquo" />So, the dreaded Balemaw Beast was just a person out for a bit of fun. <g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" priority="high" />What kind of fool thinks that's a good idea?
<g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" priority="high" />Great Cleave is full of real terrors, there's no need to add imaginary ones!
Wolves Of Winter
Track the beasts that have been attacking travelers to their lair and defeat them.
Discover what manner of beast lives at {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}
<g id="male_explain" />Speaking of real terrors, while you were off tracking the Balemaw Beast,<g id="male_spreadarms001" /> there have been reports of more attacks on the northern road.
<g id="female_crossarms" priority="high" />This time by creatures with glowing blue eyes.
"Are the eyes significant?"
<g id="male_explain" />The color of the eyes, along with their ability to manipulate ice, leads me to believe that these creatures aren't natural.
<g id="female_smackfist" />We can't allow them to make a home here in Great Cleave!
"Any ideas where they might be?"
<g id="female_thinking" />There are a number of caves where they might have made a home for themselves. <g id="male_pointsoutthere" />I suggest you check them to make sure.
<g id="female_leanforwardListen" />Have you checked the nearby ice caves? What about the ones farther away? <g id="female_crossarms" priority="high" />We have to be sure they aren't spreading.
<g id="female_salute2finger" />You look like you've been in quite a fight. <g id="female_leanforwardListen" />Was it with the Yeti? Have you banished it?
"There are no Yetis here."
<g id="male_headShakeNo" />Ah, those rimewolves are vicious. <g id="male_explain" />Clearing them out certainly helps protect the travelers in these woods.
<g id="male_dontknow" />I wonder if having them around means we're less likely to have Yetis move into the area?
The Beast Returns
The Balemaw Beast struck again! Track the beast up Mangled Heights and defeat it!
Check on Bob the "Balemaw Beast"
Travel to {POITags} to find clues about the real Balemaw Beast
Collect {itemName} as clues from {targetName}
Travel to {POITags} to find the Balemaw Beast
Defeat {targetName}
<g id="male_headShakeNo" />I hate to bring it up again, but there have been more news of the Balemaw Beast. <g id="male_explain" />These tales are far more gruesome from the last.
<g id="male_recoilAfraid"/>They talk of travelers getting ripped limb from limb.
"Do I need to check on Bob again?"
<g id="female_headnodding" />It wouldn't hurt. <g id="female_crossarms" />Though I can't imagine Bob has a hand in this, unless we were vastly mistaken about the nature of his character.
<g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" >He seemed harmless. Misguided and foolish, but harmless.
"Other than Bob do we have a lead?"
<g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" />The tales tell of horrors up in Mangled Heights. <g id="male_headShakeNo" />Sadly, this is nothing new.
<g id="male_dontknow" />All news from the heights are filled with tragic stories of travelers who got in over their heads.
<g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" priority="high" />These are dark days indeed if such beasts wander the land.
It hurts… get help…
"Bob! What happened here?"
It's real… the beast… I didn't believe… not really. It headed up the mountain. I think it took my spleen…
When I get back, I'm done impersonating that… thing.
<g id="female_leanforwardListen" />Has it been taken care of? Has the beast been destroyed?
"Mozrul has been defeated."
<g id="female_headnodding" />Let's hope that is enough to make those roads safe again. <g id="female_crossarms" priority="high" />Though I fear Mozrul will be back again in the future.
<g id="male_spreadarms001" />Thank you for your help.
<g id="male_clasphandsGrateful" />Your help is like a beacon, shining hope onto this cursed ground. <g id="male_compliment" />Your next visit is sure to chase away the gloom.
A Spot Of Luxury
Gather beautiful Spotted Pelts from Bobcats to add to Rue Horne's collection.
Hunt Bobcats in Frosted Floe to gather Spotted Pelts
Collect {itemName} from {targetName}

<g id="female_lookaroundWonder" />Have you seen the creatures out here? Don't you think their coats are absolutely divine? <g id="female_headnodding" />The stripes, the patterns, they are all so luscious!

string.comment: First Quest: A Spot of Luxury
string.speaker: Furrier Horne
string.name: RueHorne

resources.string: <g id="male_clenchfistsGetpumped01" />Good fashion is to die for! <g id="male_spreadarms001" />But best is to have others die for it rather than ourselves, yes?
"Yes?"
<g id="female_salute2finger" />I could tell you were one with a fine eye for fashion. <g id="female_gestureForward01" />Really, your outfit, superb! I couldn't design something better myself.
"Thanks, I think."
<g id="female_leanforwardListen" />Don't think, be! Fashion is all about being. <g id="male_explain" />And being covered in spots is going to be so in next year!
<g id="female_beckon" priority="high" />Do be a dear and kill some bobcats to bring me their spotted pelts, would you?
<g id="male_clenchfistsGetpumped01" />I must have those spotted pelts! Do hurry back soon!
<g id="female_headnodding" />You found me, good! With you helping to procure the bobcat pelts…
<g id="male_explain" />I felt I had to scout out what I simply needed to collect next. <g id="female_handsforwardRequest" />But first, let's take a look at those pelts.
"How do you like them?"
<g id="male_compliment" />Divine, simply divine! <g id="female_headnodding" />I do so love the feel of fresh pelts. <g id="female_chuckle" />There's something so vital about them. So intense.
Fabulous Furs
Gather fantastically colored pelts from local cougars and elk to add to Rue Horne's collection.
Hunt Snowy Cougars in the Braided Hills to gather Red Striped Pelts
Collect {itemName} from Snowy Cougar
Hunt Tainted Stags in the Icy Wilds to gather Blue Striped Pelts
Collect {itemName} from Tainted Stag
<g id="male_explain" />Speaking of intense, have you seen the colors of the fur on some of the animals up here? <g id="male_clenchfistsGetpumped01" />That striking red, that vibrant blue!
"The colors are unusual."
<g id="male_quidproquo" />More than unusual, they are extremely profitable! <g id="male_spreadarms001" />Those hues will mean I save a fortune on dyes!
<g id="female_headnodding" />The stripes are quite striking too. <g id="female_smackfist" />I simply must add them to my collection.
<g id="male_clenchfistsGetpumped01" />Those colors! They make me weak just thinking about them! <g id="female_beckon" priority="high" />I must have them!
<g id="male_leanbackCovermouth" />Oh. My. They are even better in person than from afar. Oh, and so soft. So supple.
<g id="female_headnodding" />Everyone will be clamoring to wear these, <g id="male_compliment" />and it's all possible because of you.
"It wasn't easy."
<g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" priority="high" />Good fashion is never easy. That's what makes it so good. <g id="male_compliment" />And you, dear, are one of the best. I can just tell.
Pure Delight
Gather brilliant Pure White Pelts from wolves to add to Rue Horne's collection.
Hunt Alabaster Wolves in the Icy Wilds to gather Pure White Pelts
Collect {itemName} from Alabaster Wolf
<g id="male_explain" />Speaking of the best, while traveling here I saw some simply magnificent fur. It was pure as the snow. <g id="male_spreadarms001" />Can you imagine the possibilities?
"They won't be easy to clean."
<g id="female_leanforwardListen" />Your concern is touching. <g id="male_explain" />But trust me, anyone buying pure white pelts are not worried about how to keep them clean!
<g id="female_beckonLarger" />I simply must have them!
<g id="male_explain" />Those pelts are a blank slate just waiting to be gobbled up by fashion.<g id="female_gestureForward01" /> Do be hasty in bringing them back!
<g id="male_leanbackCovermouth" />Oh, what a wonder! Imagine enfolding yourself in these furs! <g id="male_spreadarms001" />Why, you'd sink into them and give up wearing anything else.
<g id="male_compliment" />Such fine work, it's like you were born to be in fashion.
"I have other interests."
<g id="female_headnodding" />Everyone does! <g id="male_explain" />But fascinating hobbies are what keep the best designers inspired.
<g id="female_salute2finger" />Should you ever want to focus on fashion, do come back and see me!
<g id="male_spreadarms001" />Oh, you simply must stop by again! <g id="male_compliment" />I love seeing what you're wearing.
<g id="female_gestureForward01" />Truly, your choices are inspirational! Now, how do you feel about wearing more fur?
White As Bone
Collect Ancient Ivory for Valta so she can add it to a poppet.
Search for Ancient Ivory in {PoiTags}
Collect {itemName} from {targetName}
Can you hear it on the breeze? How children's laughter rustles through the leaves?
Oh how I long for a child of my own. To run through the snow in wonder, to see this world through new eyes.
"But I have seen no children here."
I have not seen children either, but I have listened long to tales older than this island. And I am certain there is a way.
All I need are some components to place into a poppet.
"A poppet, you mean like a doll?"
A doll, yes, but so much more. For like calls to like, and once complete it shall call forth a child.
Could you bring me some bones to place inside? I have already tried snow, but it does not last long enough.
I need bones of the Ancients to make this work.
These bones, so old, and yet they have not faded away.
Something makes these Ancient bones special. Something I hope will imbue this spell with longevity and strength.
Red As Blood
Collect blood red Firebright Rubies from the mine for Valta so she can add them to a poppet.
Collect Firebright Rubies in {POITags}
Collect {itemName} from chests
There is much yet that needs to be collected if I am to have a child.
Something that glistens like fresh blood, yet does not fade away. Something that keeps its color, brilliant and bright.
"Could red dye work?"
I tried dyes before, sadly they all failed. This time I shall try rubies, blood red in color. They don’t fade with time, always staying bright.
There’s a mine not far from here where rubies can be collected.
I need bright shining rubies to make this spell work. I tried blood and dye before, but those didn't last long enough.
How deep their color, like blood that has been caught and frozen in time.
See how they catch the light? These are perfect to capture the spirit of survival anyone on Aeternum needs.
Black As Ebony
Collect night black pieces of Charred Ebony for Valta so she can add them to a poppet.
Collect Charred Ebony in {POITags}
Collect {itemName} from chests
I am so close now, so close to my dream. There is one more component I need. Ebony, a rare wood even if this was not Aeternum.
I fear it will be impossible to find.
"You can't give up now."
I have heard rumors that someone brought ebony furniture to one of the forts. You could search there and see what you could find.
I fear the worst, as the rumors also told of the forts being overrun.
"If it's there, I'll find it."
Thank you. Please hurry. The poppet is almost done, and I can feel my child calling to me.
All I require now are charred pieces of ebony. Soon, my child soon, you shall know peace in my arms.
Perfect, perfect. The bones are inside, with rubies for the heart and eyes, and charred pieces of ebony to hold it all together.
The poppet is complete!
"Is that all that must be done?"
No, making the poppet was just the first step. Now it is time to visit the Wishing Tree.
An Offering For Offspring
Travel to the Wishing Tree and leave the Poppet as an offering so that Valta may one day have a child of her own.
Travel to the Wishing Tree
Place Valta's Poppet at the Wishing Tree

string.comment: Fourth Quest: An Offering for Offspring
string.speaker: Arcanist Niskanen
string.name: ArcanistNiskanen

resources.string: Tales say that the Wishing Tree grants wishes, but only if you have made a sufficient offering.
"Who decides what is sufficient?"
I don't know. What I do know is that none of my previous offerings worked. The poppet of snow and blood and ash barely lasted a day before it melted away.
The poppet of paper and dye didn't fare much better.
"What makes you so sure this time?"
Bones of Ancient guardians, rubies, ebony… if the offering is not sufficient this time, I do not know what I shall do.
Please take it to the tree for me. I do not think I can bear to go through with it again.
Please take the poppet to the Wishing Tree. I can hear the voice of my child even now.
Something is different, I can feel it. The air has a hint of warmth to it. The wind holds fewer sighs.
"But no child appeared."
These things take time. We must be patient.
The tales did not say how long it would take for the offering to be accepted, only that given time, it would.
The poppet has been placed. All there is to do now is wait.
Soon I shall start to sew a blanket for my child in anticipation of their arrival.
Perfect Piroshkis
Gather Dried Dill, Crumbly Aged Cheese, and Tenderized Meat for Aksinya.
Collect Dried Dill at {POITags}
Collect {itemName} from chests
Collect Crumbly Aged Cheese at {POITags}
Collect {itemName} from chests
Collect Tenderized Meat from Tainted Stags in {POITags}
Collect {itemName} from {targetName}
Oh those poor hungry dears.
The Soulwardens need something that sticks to their ribs and keeps them warm, if they are going to keep up their fight!
You look like you could use a good meal. Just like those Soulwardens.
"Supplies have been low up here."
Tell me about it! Why, I haven't had new deliveries in quite some time, and it shows.
I've got plenty of potatoes, but there are only so many ways you can cook them.
"You can add cheese, spices..."
I could, if we had any left! You know things are bad when even the cheese supplies run low.
Tell you what, you bring me some Dried Dill, Crumbly Aged Cheese, and some Tenderized Meat, and I'll whip up some food for us!
What I wouldn't give for some spices, cheese… anything to brighten the potatoes and onions I already have on hand.
You did it! I almost can't believe it, it's been so long since I've seen something other than potatoes to eat! Tell me I'm not dreaming.
"What are you going to make?"
Piroshkis! I have the flour for the dough, the onions, and so many potatoes.
But now I can make them truly delicious with the dill, cheese, and tender meat. We'll be feasting soon!
To Warm The Soul Warden
Bring Piping-Hot Piroshkis to Soulwarden Pedro Carrillo at Warden's Rise before they get cold!
Travel to Warden's Rise to bring piroshkis to Soulwarden Pedro Carrillo before they get cold
Travel to Warden's Rise Outpost in {timeRemaining}

string.comment: Second Quest: To Warm the Soul Wardens
string.speaker: Baker Krupin
string.name: AksinyaKrupin

resources.string: Thank you so much for bringing the ingredients.

string.comment: Second Quest: To Warm the Soul Wardens
string.speaker: Baker Krupin
string.name: AksinyaKrupin

resources.string: Now that I have what I need, I want to do something to help the Soulwardens at Warden's Rise.
"Why not here at the Bastion?"
I've already made food for everyone stationed here, and I want to spread the bounty around.
I can't imagine the kind of swill they are eating over there, the poor dears.
"They don’t have a cook like you."
All the more reason to run this basket of Piping-Hot Piroshkis over to Warden's Rise before they get cold!
Alas, you can't use the Spirit Shrine as it disrupts the delicate flavor of the piroshkis.
Off with you! You don't want those piroshkis to get cold, do you?
Supplies might be hard to come by, but I'm not leaving. Someone needs to stay and keep morale up, one piroshki at a time.
That smells wonderful! Marvelous! I haven't had any food that smelled this good for… I don't remember how long! What's the occasion?
"Aksinya wanted to say thanks."
That woman is a treasure! Now if only she would move to Warden's Rise we would be eating like kings!
Prime Resolve
Growth From the Stem
Funnelling In
Flamestarters
Reagent Retrieval
Head of the Pack
Swirling Staff Base
Flintlock
Requiring Concentration
Gather supplies for Ranger Law to make Prime Resolve.
Gather a Pulsing Staff Stem from Corrupted at Scorpius.
Gather Vortex Funnel from Corrupted at Svikin's Stand.
Gather Flint Flamestarters from Undead at Periville.
Gather Blistering Reagents from Corrupted at Greater Tribulation.
Gather a Curved Staffhead from Angry Earth at Eridanus.
Gather a Swirling Staff Base from Angry Earth at Malevolence.
Gather Orichalcum Flintlock from Undead Pirates at Stone Skull Fort.
Defeat Articulon The Unshackled in the Mangled Heights for an Azoth Concentrator.
Complete Quest: Growth From the Stem
Complete Quest: Funnelling In
Complete Quest: Flamestarters
Complete Quest: Reagent Retrieval
Complete Quest: Head of the Pack
Complete Quest: Swirling Staff Base
Complete Quest: Flintlock
Complete Quest: Requiring Concentration
Seek a stem for your staff at {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} Corrupted

string.comment: itemName = "Pulsing Staff Stem", target = S'ylanx the Unseen
string.speaker: UI

resources.string: Defeat {targetName} for {itemName}
Venture to {POITags} in search of a Vortex Funnel
Defeat {targetName} Corrupted
Defeat {targetName} Corrupted for {itemName}s
Search for Flint Flamestarters in {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} Undead
Search Open Caskets for {itemName}
Brave {POITags} for reagents
Defeat {targetName} Corrupted
Search chests within {POITags} for {itemName}
Claim a head for your staff from the Dryads of {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} Dryads
Defeat {targetName} Dryads for a {itemName}
Climb the tower {POITags} in search of a base for your staff
Defeat {targetName} Dryads
Defeat {targetName} Dryads for a {itemName}
Search for flintlocks at {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} Pirates
Search chests within {POITags} for {itemName}
Delve into the {POITags} in search of an Azoth Concentrator
Defeat {targetName} Corrupted
Defeat {targetName} for {itemName}
"What did you hear?"
<g id="male_crossarmsJudge" />Here in Aeternum, where doom haunts our every move, <g id="male_nodProud" />we must hang on to the things that make us feel alive.
<g id="male_explain" />To that end, there is a legend we tell in Great Cleave that warms our hearts.
"How does it go?"
<g id="male_explain" />There is a powerful fire staff, called Prime Resolve. <g id="male_fistpumpRight" />The legend goes that it can turn a Corrupted enemy to cinders in a flash.
<g id="male_nodProud" />I’d call that heartwarming, wouldn’t you?
"Is it real?"
<g id="female_chuckle" />Yes, if you make it so! <g id="female_order" />Go forth and gather the parts needed to build this legendary weapon!
<g id="male_clenchfistsGetpumped01" />Setting things on fire, what a wonderful way to remind yourself you're truly alive.
<g id="male_nodProud" />Isn’t fire wonderful? It keeps us warm, cooks our food, burns away the darkness and the filth and the pain…
<g id="male_spreadhands" />At last, Prime Resolve is completed. It’s beautiful. <g id="female_cheerFistpump" />Truly a force to be reckoned with!
<g id="female_salute2finger" />Knowing you wield it will keep me warm during my cold patrols.
"I'll burn a few in your name."
<g id="female_chuckle" />You're too kind. <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />May Prime Resolve turn you into a beacon of fiery hope.
A burning flame that refuses to go out as it purifies Corruption.
Glimmering Mercy

Gather the parts, wholesome and true, for a life-giving staff made whole. Glittering, gleaming, restore and renew the Glimmering Mercy's soul. Talk to Ranger Madaki in Shattered Mountain when the task is complete.
"Yes, I've been there."

string.comment: male referring to female (Ranger Madaki), male referring to male (Ranger Rochford)
string.speaker: Ranger Balogun
string.name: RangerBalogun

resources.string: <g id="male_explain" />That place has eaten many careless Soulwardens. <g id="male_crossarmsJudge" />Your accomplishment is impressive… to some.

string.comment: male referring to female (Ranger Madaki), male referring to male (Ranger Rochford)
string.speaker: Ranger Balogun
string.name: RangerBalogun

resources.string: <g id="female_shrugShort" />But no one triumphs alone, do they? <g id="female_leanforwardListen" />I’ve heard you’ve been getting help from my friend Madaki in Shattered Mountain.
"We all need help, now and then."
<g id="male_headNodYes" />Some of us. Madaki said you've made a discovery about the Corrupted's weaponry. <g id="female_leanforwardListen" />Let's see the pages you've found.
<g id="male_goodnews" />Oh! The plans for this staff, Glimmering Mercy, are actually a song. <g id="male_nodProud" />That’s whimsical.
"It's a song?"
<g id="male_explain" />The plans are a collection of short bits compiled into a poem called the "Symphony of Mercy."
<g id="female_gestureForward01" />If you're serious about practicing Life Magic, follow these lyrics to get your hands on the Glimmering Mercy.
<g id="female_headnodding" />Getting lost in song is quite easy, which explains Rochford. <g id="male_listenforward" >Maybe I myself should follow his tune a little more!
<g id="female_leanforwardListen" />So, you've learned the Symphony of Mercy? I won't pretend to know the work of musicians, <g id="female_headnodding" />but I can at least whistle a tune as I work.
<g id="male_explain" />Give me a moment to extract the essences I need, and I'll finish crafting the Mercy.
"It's looking good."

<g id="female_headnodding" />Yes, this is a fine Life Staff. Just seeing it glimmer puts my heart at ease. <g id="male_clenchfistsGetpumped01" />Wielding the Mercy in battle will inspire awe in your allies and fear in your enemies.
<g id="female_giveitem" priority="high" />Take it, in your hands I know this staff will do some good.
Prelude of the Acolytes
Blood-stained robes and cursed staves, nefarious acolytes raise their minions forth. Find them in the heights west by north, and send them to their cursed graves.
The Wyrdwood Adagio
Weeping trees, they be not willow nor withe, growing wild in the winding way. Survive the wanton whaling of the forestwalkers, and your woes be rewarded with the trees' blue tears.
Shaman's Scherzo
Another place, another body, another time, the wisest of shamans are not of here but a reality that bends. The myrrh they carry is their vehicle, the key to a magic that transcends.
The Stone Skull Shanty

One swig for courage, two swigs to sleep, three swigs to settle your strife, and four swigs when under the knife. Give me that bottom of the barrel wine, freshly butchered swine, and a wench for a good time.
Zarabanda del Ojo Rojo
The red eye of the bay, the red eye of the bay, the tower calling sailors to their doom. Deep in the tower, hidden away, an ancient and powerful rune.
Requiem for the Lost
Temporary forms made immortal and pinned to the earth in sorrow. The faithless turn their back on the path.
Passepied de la Tour
In the heart of the craters, the soul of Aeternum, climb towards the sky. Peek into the mirror and learn the ways of those that defend the tower.
Sonata of the Shattered
Dive into the belly of the beast, and the heart of Corruption. Though light may cast out the darkness, it in turn casts a shadow.

Recover the components needed to create the Azure Ravager, and deliver them to Ranger Madaki in Mountainhome.
Forging the Azure Ravager
"It's all true."
<g id="female_headnodding" />I know. I started seeing the influx of strange items coming into the forts nearby, <g id="male_spreadarms001" />and I didn't question her any longer.
<g id="male_explain" />Something unusual was going on, so I started to look into it.
"What did you find?"
<g id="male_listenforward" />There is an amazing hatchet, I'm sure Madaki showed you. <g id="male_spreadarms001" />I can imagine the way it handles in a fight!
<g id="male_clenchfistsGetpumped01" />We can't let the Corrupted make it first!
"What should I do?"
<g id="male_explain" />I've put together a list of everything that matches up with this new Hatchet design.
<g id="male_pointsoutthere" />You'll have to search across Aeternum for some of the items, <g id="female_headnodding" />but I'm certain you can do it. You found me up here, after all.
I’d love to join you, but I have other duties. I have to try and stop any more of those supplies from reaching the forges in Caminus.
<g id="male_compliment" />Glad you made it back. Wow, some of this stuff must have been hard to find. <g id="female_salute2finger" />Nicely done.
<g id="male_explain" />Give me a bit to integrate these last components you've brought, and we'll see what we end up with.
"Hopefully, a hatchet."
<g id="female_headnodding" />This is no ordinary hatchet! Whoever designed it was a master smith.
<g id="male_rememberBig" />A name is coming to me: Azure Ravager, the slayer of Corrupted. <g id="male_clenchfistsGetpumped01" />Yes, that’s got a nice ring to it!

Wooden Hearts and Iron Heads

<g id="male_explain" />There are still a few more items on Fowler's shopping list, and I still have a lot to do to make sure this Hatchet won't do anything crazy, <g id="male_spreadarms001" />like try and suck your soul out.
<g id="male_dontknow" />Kidding... I think.
"Are you sure about this?"
<g id="male_dontknow" />Honestly, I'm not entirely sure what will happen when this weapon is finished.
<g id="female_crossarms" priority="high" />All I do know for certain is that we'll have it and they won't... and that'll hurt them in more ways than one.
<g id="male_pointsoutthere" />You bring me the components, <g id="female_crossarms" >and I'll get this thing made.
<g id="male_compliment" />It looks like you've made a lot of progress already!

<g id="male_explain" />I've been working to alter this recipe to channel Azoth instead of Corruption... and with what you've brought me, <g id="female_headnodding" />I think I'll be able to make this work.
"Sounds like a good plan."
<g id="male_pointsoutthere" />By the time you bring back the rest of the components, <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />I'll have most of the critical pieces complete.
<g id="female_smackfist" />Then we'll get to see what this design can really do.

<g id="female_headnodding" />Felt good to be up and active, you know?
"I do."

<g id="male_rememberBig" />Oh, Ranger Madaki sent a runner earlier, in case you stopped by. She's almost completed the Hatchet, and it looks like with what you have, she'll have the final pieces she needs. <g id="female_beckonLarger" />Hurry up there!

Recover the components needed to create the Rampant Conviction, then deliver them to Ranger Madaki in Mountainhome.
The Rampant Conviction of Hope
"Why do you ask?"
<g id="male_explain" />I've received her instructions, and have set my efforts to stopping the production of Corrupted weapons.
<g id="male_spreadhands" />To that end, I've compiled reports to track the weapons that have recently passed through the valley.
"That's quite a task."
<g id="female_headnodding" />It needed to be done. <g id="male_explain" />It's safe to assume that most, if not all, of the items are related to the creation of this Hammer.
<g id="male_explain" />I've organized them into a list for you, to aid you in your endeavor.
"This will be useful, thanks."
<g id="female_salute2finger" />You're welcome. I shall continue my efforts to stop the Corrupted here.
<g id="male_spreadhands" />I leave the rest in your capable hands. <g id="female_salute2finger" />Best of luck.
<g id="male_listenforward" priority="high" />Be watchful, stick to the shadows, and don’t move until you need to. <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />This tactic has served me well over the years.
<g id="female_salute2finger" />Didn't get too lost out there, I hope?
<g id="male_spreadhands" />Let's take a look at what you brought me, hm? <g id="female_headnodding" />Oh, yes... these will do nicely for what's needed.
"It's a fine piece of work."
<g id="male_compliment" />Indeed. A beautiful weapon. It needs a name...
<g id="female_smackfist" />I've got it! <g id="male_explain" />The Rampant Conviction of Hope. A little long, but I like it. Take it, and show those Corrupted just how strong our hope is.

<g id="female_salute2finger" />Great work, {playerName}. I haven’t been idle either.
<g id="male_explain" />Eight caravans attempted to bring additional supplies through the valley…<g id="male_dontknow" />they will not reach their destinations.

Frostbitten Fighters
Gather components to make the Legendary Ice Gauntlet Rimelash.
Gather the Corrupted Bindings that will hold together the gauntlet from Legatus General Patrick at Svikin's Stand. Talk to Ranger Madaki at Shattered Mountain.
Gather the Frozen Orichalcum Plating from the frozen crown of North Myrkgard, Greater Tribulation.
Gather the Chilled Fungi that grow upon the Elite Alcazarian Guardians of Malevolence for an extra kick of frost.
Kill Corrupted on the way to gather S'ylanx the Unseen's frozen, twisted heart to make a core for the gauntlet.
Gather Frostforged Grips to make up the hand of the gauntlet from the Corrupted of Infernal Host.
Gather Everbite Ectoplasm from the wraiths of frigid Periville, their cold everlasting in undeath.
Gather Icy Shot from the Skullworm Pirates of Stone Skull Fort, a special ammunition they keep on them for inflicting maximum pain.
Defeat Dryads and their leader Parthenocissus for his Frostbitten Vine that will wrap around the core of the gauntlet.
"This isn't about the weather..."
<g id="male_spreadhands" />Just think of it, holding the power of a snowstorm in one's hand.
<g id="male_explain" />There's a weapon that allows for this and more, the gauntlet Rimelash. <g id="female_smackfist" />With it you can freeze enemies and shatter their frozen forms.
"Sounds impressive!"
<g id="female_headnodding" />It is! <g id="male_explain" />Rimelash's cold seeps into the very marrow of an enemy, freezing them from the inside-out.
<g id="female_crossarms" />This is exactly the kind of weapon we could use,<g id="male_pointsoutthere" /> if you're willing to take on its construction.
"How do I start?"
<g id="male_spreadhands" />Great Cleave is a wonderful place, if you seek the power of winter. The creatures here have ice in their veins – <g id="female_smackfist" />take it from them.
<g id="male_explain" />Once you get the pieces, Madaki can help you put them together.
<g id="male_headShakeNo" />This land is full of shifting forces greater than all of us. <g id="female_crossarms" priority="high" />But we won’t be afraid. We will master them, in time.

<g id="male_clenchfistsGetpumped01" />What a resounding success! I present to you: <g id="female_giveitem" />Rimelash, the instrument of icy destruction that will freeze and fell your enemies before they even know what's hit them!
"I get shivers thinking about it."
<g id="female_headnodding" />It is a great boon to have this weapon in the hands of someone so capable.
<g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />The Corrupted will shatter under its power.

No. Not that! Please. You don't have to hurt me.
I'll make the bombs. All of them. I-I'll give them to your Captain.
Have you had a chance to talk to the people here? It's inspiring to see them stay strong through such adversity.
I came here for my son, but I'm staying for them. The least I can do is provide them with decent meals.
I am a seeker of stories.
Tell me, warrior. Do you have any tales for me?
Ah… The Soulwardens told me about how you fought Commander Thorpe.
But I want to hear all the details from you. What weapons did you use? Did you die at any point or could you keep fighting through his attacks?
Do you see the red tides around us? They are an omen of the bloody war to come.
Don't worry, soldier. The 19th Legion is invincible. We will make Pompey pay for his sins against the Senate.
"Pompey already paid for his sins."
Oh. That is - maybe, it's possible. The island plays tricks with my mind.
Plans of the past. Plans of the future. War after war. The lines start getting blurry after a while.
Don't come too close. I prefer not seeing the faces of the people I may have to kill.
There's a fool among us, who is spying on us in exchange for Corrupted coin. Pray it isn't you.
Be gentle with Shang. The Corrupted put her through a lot, trying to get her to make explosives for them.
I left my mark on their red skulls and I'll happily destroy anyone who threatens her.
Hah. Good work breaking down the Corrupted mining operations.
First go for their morale. Then go for their heads when they're bent in anguish.
Tell me, what ails you? If it's something minor, Mabel can help.
A group of soldiers is expected back at the Eastern Outpost. Their wounds will be grave and their time will be less. I must hurry to them.
I rushed here as soon as I heard about Yonas's condition.
Have you done anything to stem the bleeding? Keep his head upright and keep checking his heartbeat.
I hope you're faring well, traveler. You know, Tapas helped my brother in his last days, and now, he helps all of us.
When the world gets overwhelming, remember there are still healers like him who roam the island.
Oh no! This is terrible. How are you coping, {playerName}!
Yonas secured the outposts and made us feel safe again. It's a shame to see him like this.
You look like you've just come from the battlefield. What keeps you sane through your struggles?
For me, it is the people here. Ingram's warmth, Wang's wit, Heyl's strength. We look out for each other.
Haha! Is it true you've found more Soulwardens? And one named Yash?
He's a jolly fellow from what I remember. Hope he hasn't changed too much after his dealings with the Corrupted.
Yes, I stand here, greeting weary adventurers like yourself.
Guiding souls to the inn, the soulless to the winds and the Corrupted to Heyl's sword.
Greetings, {playerName}! I go by the name Lady Taehwa. I gave up my first name when I failed to save my brother from the Corrupted.
I come out here everyday, hoping to receive news about him.
Hey! I heard you rescued more Soulwardens. Any news of my brother?
He's a Taehwa like me. Taller with long black hair and a moustache.
We are lucky to be reborn as we are.
I feel like I'm cheating karma every time I don't get reborn as a lizard, especially after all the wrong that I have done.
Stay wary in this cave, stranger! I fear the ice wolves have a magic I haven't come across before.
Those seemingly innocuous patterns on the wall? They blinded me when I touched them.
"Are they a different language?"
You know, that's possible. But these symbols are so different from each other, it seems like they don't belong to the same system.
We have so many unique languages in the Old World. I'm sure Aeternum has others that we've never seen.
Read
Ice Chronicles
Find Kazu, the owner of the journal. Maybe he can teach you more about the glyphs in Aeternum.
(A journal that looks like it was carelessly forgotten.
It could be a daydreaming owner, could be a person running from danger...)
A glyph in its smallest unit seems to denote a word. Some patterns have single glyphs. While some have many glyphs joined together to form a complex word.
Given the location of these glyphs, one could assume they have some connection with the Ancient monuments.
Don't hurt the wolf. It's done me no harm!
Read further.
Could the glyphs reveal how the Ancient Guardians are powered? Could this knowledge be useful for our fight against Corruption? I must continue my search and list every glyph I find.
The merchant mentioned seeing a different sort of symbol on the cave of the ice wolves. I must head there next. - Ishida Kazu
Could the glyphs reveal how the Ancient Guardians are powered? Could this knowledge be useful for our fight against Corruption? I must continue my search and list every glyph I find.
Is this really my journal? The leather cover, the embossed kanji. The words I'll never see-
Do not touch that glyph. It looks harmless, but it has a strange magic.
"It's rounder than on the monuments."
Yes, I noticed that too. This pattern has an almost feral quality. The glyphs at the Ancient sites seem so refined in comparison.
Interesting that these patterns could exist in the same language.
Go to Kazu
Speak with Kazu
Glyph Of The Wolf
Kazu turned blind when he tried to activate the strange new glyph. Help him research a similar one at Mokosh Springs.
The merchant said he saw similar symbols at a nearby waterfall.
I must find a way to get there and search the place. We need every advantage we can get against the demons that inhabit this island.
"I can be your eyes."
Then you shall be of great help, my friend. Be careful. Do not touch the glyph or you may suffer a fate similar to mine.
The ice wolves may also have been linked to the shards that pierced my eyes, but I'm not sure.
Did you find the symbol?
Yoku dekita! You have proved yourself a valuable ally today. Did you really see an ice wolf near this glyph too?
I wonder if these symbols are somehow connected to the beasts. I need more examples before I can be sure.
Go to Mokosh Springs
Examine the wolf glyph
Talk to the ice wolf
<g id="male_explain" />Once we understand the island more, we can tap into its powers to keep ourselves and our communities safe.
<g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />I wish you luck on your journey, friend. <g id="male_spreadhands" />I hope our paths cross again one day.
<g id="male_dontknow" />Have you ever felt like today is exactly as yesterday was, till the days themselves bleed into each other and you start to doubt the existence of time?
<g id="male_headShakeNo" />I'm cursed to repeat the same day over and over again. <g id="male_headShakeNo" />It's so exasperating!
The Curse That Goes Round
Break the curse that has Simone going around in circles.
<g id="male_spreadhands" />I don't believe I've seen you before. You seem different, an extra element in this stationary world.
You may be the answer to the curse. <g id="female_beckonLarger" />Oh, please, please, help me break free from whatever magic has been placed upon me!
"What is this curse?"
<g id="male_explain" />My day keeps looping in on itself. I wake up, I walk a few meters. <g id="male_dontknow" />I lose consciousness.
<g id="male_headShakeNo" />I wake up. I start again. Always the same path. I could tell you the exact patterns on the trees around us. <g id="female_gestureForward01" />I've seen them so many times!
"Who would wish you evil?"
<g id="male_rememberBig" />My aunt. She made me leave France after I revealed what she did with the Duke.

<g id="male_headShakeNo" />If ever there was a woman capable of hatred, of vengeance, it would be her. <g id="female_beckonLarger" />Please find whatever vile thing she's put in my bags and remove it.
<g id="male_listenforward" />Did you find the curse my aunt placed upon me? Did you remove it? <g id="female_beckonLarger" />Please, tell me you removed it!
<g id="male_dontknow" />Well? What cursed thing did my aunt leave in my bag? <g id="male_explain" />There must be a cross, tied leaves, a potion? At the very least, a note?
"I found an amulet."

<g id="female_smackfist" />Aha! It is the culprit. <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />Thank you for saving me! Take the amulet or toss it away. <g id="male_headShakeNo" />I have no place for my aunt or her evildoings in my life.
Go to Ascension Rime
Find Simone's bag to break the curse
<g id="male_headShakeNo" />My aunt's magic is stronger than I expected. <g id="female_clenchfistsSuffer" />Oh, she torments me with her traps.
<g id="male_dontknow" />I fear I'm forever doomed to repeat this life. If only there was a way to escape!
A Passing Good Knight
Assist an aged and possibly delusional knight with his plan to impress the Soulwardens.
<g id="male_clenchfistsGetpumped01" />Fie on the Corrupted!
<g id="female_salute2finger" />Hail, ser. <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />I am a worthy knight, come from afar in search of the Soulwardens.
<g id="male_headShakeNo" />But alas, I was refused. <g id="male_dontknow" />It is no order for the elderly, they told me.
“You are a bit old.”
<g id="male_outfitproud" />Age has not dimmed my valor. <g id="female_smackfist" />I will prove this to the Soulwardens.
<g id="male_explain" />North of here lies a Corruption stronghold known to hold their foul war designs. <g id="male_outfitproud" />I intend to extract them, as it were.
"You want to steal their plans?"

<g id="female_headnodding" />Indeed I do, but I could use an ally. <g id="male_listenforward" priority="high" />What say you? Breach the interior, search the chests for plans, and I’ll do the same. <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />Afterwards, meet me north of the fort.
<g id="female_smackfist" />At Arms! <g id="male_clenchfistsGetpumped01" />For the Soulwardens!
<g id="male_outfitproud" />With our forces combined, we shall prevail against the Corrupted!
"I found their battle plans."
<g id="male_outfitproud" />By my troth, that was well fought. You have truly earned that most noble of titles: <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />a passing good knight.
Go to {POITags}
Search chests for battle plans
Armed At All Points
Defeat the Siege Engineers at Riven Anvil.
<g id="female_smackfist" />No quarter for Siege Engineers!
"No quarter!"
<g id="female_gestureForward01" />Let us take measure of these plans. Hmm.
<g id="female_shocked" />What treachery is this? <g id="male_headShakeNo" />Those villains are building Siege Engines to wreak destruction upon the Soulwardens.
"Siege engines?"
<g id="male_headShakeNo" />In sooth, I don’t understand their exact purpose, <g id="male_outfitproud" />but wit ye well, they intend great harm to the Wardens.
"We can’t allow that."
<g id="male_headNodYes" />Verily. <g id="male_pointsoutthere" />The Siege Engineers are toiling nearby. If we defeat them now,<g id="female_smackfist" /> their evil schemes die also.

<g id="male_convince01" />Once more I entreat your aid. <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />Not for my sake, but for the Wardens. <g id="female_smackfist" />Let’s to it! <g id="male_clenchfistsGetpumped01" />At arms!
<g id="male_explain" />‘Siege Engineers’ are building weapons of war nearby. We must defeat them so the evil never comes to pass.
"I killed some Siege Engineers."
<g id="female_clenchfistsSuffer" />That... was the stuff of legends. The Soulwardens are safe… for now.
Go to {POITags}
Defeat the Siege Engineers at {POITags}
Battle Wounds Bestow Honor
Alas and alack! As Sir Hotspur lays stricken, accept the mantle and report to the Soulwardens.
<g id="female_clenchfistsSuffer" />Let not my blood be spilt in vain.
"Are you all right?"

<g id="female_clenchfistsSuffer" />Those fiends gave me such a buffet that I can’t even stand. <g id="female_clenchfistsSuffer" />It vexes me to stay behind, but the Soulwardens must be made known of the evil designs against them.
<g id="female_clenchfistsSuffer" />Those fiends gave me such a buffet that I can’t even stand.
<g id="female_clenchfistsSuffer" />It vexes me to stay behind, but the Soulwardens must be made known of the evil designs against them.
"You do look bad."
<g id="female_clenchfistsSuffer" />Indeed, and I hurt the more so.

<g id="male_clutchhead01" />One last favour I ask of you. There is a map to the Soulwardens buried in a certain grave. <g id="female_clenchfistsSuffer" />Follow it and bear them report on the Siege Engineers. *cough* At arms!
<g id="male_clutchhead01" />Find the map buried in a grave. It shall lead you to the Soulwardens. Warn them of the dire threat against them.
"We foiled a plot against you."
<g id="female_salute2finger" />Hello {playerName}, I’m Zhen Chang, a Soulwarden assigned to Eastburn Outpost.
<g id="male_listenforward" priority="high" />How are you liking the cold? I wish I had stayed home insteading of heading into this snowy waste.
<g id="male_lookaroundBored" priority="high" />If it's not one thing, it's another. No rest for the weary, friend. Not when there's work to be done.

<g id="female_crossarmsSuspicious" />Did that odd-talking old fool put you up to this, the one with all the armor? <g id="male_listenforward" priority="high" />Well, perhaps not such a old fool after all.
"He fought bravely."

<g id="female_nodConsider" />Oh? Great courage sometimes comes in unusual vessels. Wrinkly and withered, but such results cannot be disputed. <g id="female_nodding" />Perhaps he has the making of a Soulwarden after all. <g id="female_salute2finger" />Thank you for bringing this to my attention.
Go to {POITags}
Dig up the map to the Soulwardens
